for_sales.sales_text:
Needs a new owner. Open to offers 

Designed by Maurice Griffiths, the first and largest at 28’6” to be built in the range of transom sterned Cutters. She was a development of Olive Mary, which was built entirely to the owners requirements. Seaway is the boat Maurice Griffiths would have liked Olive Mary to have been. She was built in Portsmouth, 1930 by a well known builder and has been here abouts ever since. Sails well and stands upto a breeze. Good interior space with 4 births. A well looked after 27hp engine and a good set of sails. Ready for this season with a coat of paint.

Featured in Maurice Griffiths book Sixty Years a Yacht Designer.

Currently ashore and covered in Portsmouth.

boat.full_description:
Designed by Maurice Griffiths, the first and largest at 28’6” to be built in the range of transom sterned Cutters. She was a development of Olive Mary, which was built entirely to the owners requirements. Seaway is the boat Maurice Griffiths would have liked Olive Mary to have been. She has suffered two fires but sails on regardless.

Featured in Maurice Griffiths book Sixty Years a Yacht Designer.
boat.name: Seaway
boat.short_description: Seaway has been based in Portsmouth all her life. She has suffered two fires but sails on regardless.
